final_answer:
The image is satirical because it contrasts the unrealistic and extensive beauty standards often applied to women with the simplistic and minimal standards typically applied to men. 

On the left, an angry woman holds a long list labeled "Beauty Standards," reflecting the numerous and often unrealistic expectations placed on women's appearance. 

On the right, a calm, smiling woman holds a document with a single requirement, ">180," implying that men's beauty standards are reduced to just a height requirement. 

This stark contrast humorously highlights the absurdity and inequality in societal expectations of beauty for different genders, emphasizing the satire on how much more pressure is placed on women compared to men.
